newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks surge 4.39 percent at close.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks surge 4.39 percent at close.

text.p: Pakistani stocks surged above 1,700 points near the close on Sunday on euphoria fuelled by hopes that a new Nawaz Sharif-led government will stabilise politics and pursue pro-business policies, dealers said.
"The market is on fire. Political uncertainty has ended and people see a stable government," dealer Zaina Norsherwan said. "Sharif enjoys the confidence of trade and business people."
The Karachi 100-share index rose 71.97 points, or 4.39 percent, to end at 1,711.25. Gainers led losers 329 to 37. Hub Power rose 2.15 rupees to 41.25 and PTCL 1.15 to 34.30.
